tool.name: Trim putative adapter sequence
tool.command: ln -s '$input1' ./forward.fastq && ln -s '$input2' ./reverse.fastq && trim_adapters #if '$settings.advanced' == 'advanced' -d '$settings.edit_distance' -f '$settings.fudge' -s '$settings.trim_start' -r '$settings.rc_length' #end if forward.fastq reverse.fastq

param.name: edit_distance
param.label: The maximum edit distance permitted when aligning the paired reads

param.name: fudge
param.label: An arbitrary number of extra bases to trim from the ends of reads

param.name: trim_start
param.label: Trim this number of bases from the start of each sequence

param.name: rc_length
param.label: Use the reverse complement of this number of from the beginning of the reverse read to align reads

tool.help:
usage: trim_adapters [-d EDIT_DISTANCE] [-f FUDGE] [-s TRIM_START] [-r RC_LENGTH] forward reverse
description: Trim adapters from paired-end HTS reads.
positional arguments: forward The (optionally gzipped) FASTQ file containing the forward reads. reverse The (optionally gzipped) FASTQ file containing the reverse reads.
